description: I LOVE this place. Full disclosure, I've never been here for the food.  But, it is a great chill place to meet people after dinner.  In my experience, you can count on it having some people hanging out but still be able to get a place at the bar or one of the cozy tables. I love the vibe, not a dive exactly, but not at all trendy or pretentious. Just a great reliable spot that is far better than any other pub in the area.
author: Andria C.

description: Late night food my ass as Yelp represents. They stop serving food at 10. You're not late night bitches. Late night is after 1am
author: PJ L.

description:
Quaint. The portions weren't too bad. I had meatloaf and bbq wings. The wings weren't the greatest though. I'd try the tavern again but maybe mix up my choice of food. 
One or two items were crossed off the menu that I was looking forward to eating based on other yelp reviews.
author: Brian B.

description: A great dive pub with free popcorn, peanuts and pretzels. And a full pub menu with a kitchen that closes at ten. Wonderful old school atmosphere, and Best of all a big room in back where groups can congregate. A lovely spot to hang for a few hours.
author: David A R.

description:
Free popcorn/pretzels/peanuts, cheap beers and a cozy, slightly divey atmosphere.  Service is average to borderline surly, but ehh, lower your expectations.

Mostly I'm a sucker for popcorn and cheap beer, but I like that there's plenty of seating and the vibe is pretty relaxing.  I was also told by a friend that they have free hot dogs sometimes so I plan on continuing to come back to see if this is true!
author: Stephanie K.

description: This restaurant is too good to take walk ins. Avoid this terrible service and the rude people on the phone!
author: Tiya X.

description:
This is by far my fav place. Brian is AMAZING and the drinks and food are fantastic!

With so many places to choose from in the city, they have an amazing Chicken under a brick and steak for the price. The folks that hang here are locals and guests. 

The atmosphere is clean, kind and a gem in the City!
author: Stacey M.

description: We stopped by for dinner at around 6:30 on a Thursday night. There was no wait when we arrived, and we seated ourselves. The menu isn't huge but there is a bit of a variety to choose from (burgers, steaks, salad, wings, pasta, etc.). Most all of the menu is also very reasonably priced. We got steak, a burger, and an order of the garlic fires as an appetizer. We were a little disappointed that the appetizer came WITH the meal instead of before but all the food came out quickly, hot, and correct. Overall good experience and would recommend to friends/family.
author: Madison M.

description:
I was looking for a place to kill some time before meeting with friends for dinner around the block at The Rambler so I stumbled into White Horse Tavern. I THINK that this place was inspired by The White Horse Tavern in Newport, Rhode Island which some say is the oldest tavern in the US. I asked our server but he had no idea and I was lazy to ask anyone else because whatever.

They had about 4 beers on tap and a fake fireplace that didn't produce any heat. It looked so fake they might as well not even have it. Because it was cold and I was sitting by a fake fire place giving me nothing, I have to knock off a star. Furthermore, they did't even have a classic cocktail menu to go along with the theme.

I got some sweet potato garlic fries which were decent--I wish I had gotten the regular (salt and pepper) garlic fries instead. I now know that sweet potato fries and garlic don't necessarily mix--better as separate entities.

I'd come back to grab a random drink at a random bar, but this place is just alright. I was expecting more with the cool theme but it's really just a dive bar (so if that's what you're looking for this is it).
author: Marlon T.

description: Great food at reasonable prices, cheap booze, Great people. What more do you really need?
author: Sean B.

description:
Great relaxing little pub near Union Square. Particularly great if you have a hard time finding anyplace in SF that doesn't blast loud, shitty music incessantly so that you can't even think much less talk to someone. Also nice to be in a place that doesn't have a million TVs lining the walls and screaming for attention.

Fish and Chips are excellent, more fries than I can eat. Plenty of beers for around 5 bucks. I question the '2 dollar sign $$' rating on Yelp, this is about as inexpensive as it gets in this town for anything besides fast food.

Bartenders and Waiters are always friendly.

Fast becoming one of my favorite places to hang out in the neighborhood!
author: Mike J.

description:
The worst service experience that I have never met before. The waitress just walked around and ignored customers with her poker face!
If u wanna have a wonderful night,I suggest u don't come to here,u will get angry before u enjoy ur drink!
author: Juan L.

description: We ordered the salt & garlic fries & they were amazing! The shrimp linguine was bad ass & my man pants had the fish & chips. Service was awesome! We will definitely be back! The prices were also spot on. If you are looking for good food, atmosphere and save $ this is your spot!
author: Carrie M.

description:
We stayed at the Beresford hotel and decided to walk around and find food. After eating some happy hour food at a sad diner nearby, we decided to look for a better alternative. Eventually we ended up back at our hotel, and decided to give this bar a try. The interior felt very nice, drinks were reasonably priced. Very friendly staff. We sat down in the corner and ordered some shrimp and chips and the caprese salad. The food came quick and it looked like food you'd get a a fancy cocktail restaurant. The shrimp was fresh a huge. Perfectly breaded. Fries were also fresh and crispy. We really enjoyed our meal.

As we are and drank, a group of people were doing shots at the bar. I guess one guy had a bit too much. I went outside for a smoke, the drunk large dude falls straight on his face right in the middle of the sidewalk. As his friend and I try to help him up, I noticed that his nose was bleeding. I pointed it out, the drunk man wipes his nose with his hand, looks at, then proceeds to wipe the blood on his hair like hair gel. That was my cue to go back inside. His friend was calling him a cab.
author: Yuri S.

description:
My twinkle two BRAVO! Come one come all if you wanna hang with gangsters of industry, sip a fine cocktail, and have some free popcorn. 

Lotta out-a-towners come for the accents and stay fir the strong pours. Me likey but not a top bar.
author: Zachary D.

description: Good beer, excellent fish and chips (ask for sweet potato fries instead of the regular ones, it's awesome!), Service was great. If you're looking for a inexpensive and nice restaurant in SF, this is one of those.
author: David B.

description: My friend and I were trying to order some food to go. We stood there for a long time while just waiitng for the menu. The waitress ignored us; she was walking around and acting like she was busy. That's fine, we were understanding and waited some more before calling her. She left without acknowledging us! We were extremely disappointed. We weren't expecting perfect service, but she should at least show people respect!
author: Sandra C.

description: A comfortable place for several glasses of drinks in winter night,  ordered red and white wine, and they are really tasty!
author: Thomas F.

description:
This place is not the White Horse in Oakland. Which is fine. 

There's shuffleboard and cheap beer. I like the bartenders. It's a nice place to hang out. I live very nearby. I'm there like four nights a week.  

There's food, too, 'till around 10pm. 

It's got a weird "Britain Pavilion At Epcot Center" vibe that I don't mind. It's attached the Beresford Hotel, which is a budget hotel that sounds like it attracts a lot of UK travelers. But like, literally. On account of all the accents, see. 

The only downside is that somebody seems to get super, super, super wrecked there most nights. Probably because they know they can just go upstairs to their hotel rooms? Smart.
author: Jim M.

description:
Saw all the good reviews for this place so decided to give it a try! We got there and was greeted by a male bartender who was friendly and attentive.

After getting some drinks, we were told to "seat yourself", so we ventured to the back to find a table. We found a small table and waited for a server to help us.

We were there for about an hour total and wasn't offered a menu or anything by the female server. She kept running back and forth from the kitchen acting like it was the busiest night of her life! (The place really wasn't that busy)

We finished our drinks and took our business elsewhere.
author: John K.

description:
Hoooooo, I've found the place!

Yep -- it's so obvious. But being British, I've got to have some place that reminds me even just a little bit of home. Something about the way the bar is set up, that they do fish and chips, that there's shuffleboard... In any case, I'm a fan.

The beer is about $5. This, alone, should lure you in. The crowd's decent enough and the staff are really friendly. They do free popcorn, if that's your thing. 

The fish and chips are in no way traditional, but that's not to say they're not decent -- I happen to love fries and I kinda like the way the batter was more SFC than trad British batter. Either way, the fish was cooked well and tasted fresh. Bonus: the tartar sauce was amazing. Bonus bonus: we saw some folks playing D&D. Love it.

It's definitely going to be a regular spot for me.
author: Rowena H.

description:
Some local friends wanted to meet us at White Horse, a pub that they are regulars at. Locals know best, right? This no-frills English tavern is in a tourist filled area, and yet it remains decently priced, not full of tourists, and unpretentious. There's no trendy decor, but you are really transported into a old fashioned pub, resplendent with a fake fireplace and weapons hanging on the mantle. Fair warning, you will probably not have LTE in here. I was trying to check in but there was no connection.

There are plenty of places to sit, and I instantly beelined to the popcorn machine and stocked up on ~free~ pub mix and popcorn. They only have 3 or so beers on tap, but they had Langunitas so it was ok. We settled into seats in the back corner of the place to play Settlers of Catan and Cards Against Humanity. Since the bartender/waiter knew our friends, the service was pretty good, with plenty of joking insults being thrown around by both parties. I didn't order food myself, but I did have someone else's lemon pepper wings, which had good flavor and crispy skin. The fries are also nice.

As the night progressed, more people came in and a group of guys started a rowdy game of shuffleboard. I'm sure we didn't help with the noise level after we drank a round of Fernet! If you haven't had it, Fernet is a liquor that tastes a little like licorice and a lot like mouthwash. It reaaaally got me, haha. I had never heard of it, but apparently it is very popular in SF. 

If you're feeling knackered after a long day at work, make sure to go with your favorite mates to White Horse, but don't get too tanked or you'll look like a wanker!
author: Ruth T.

description:
I use to love this place about 2 years ago. Based off a british pub look. Warm and welcoming. Those bartenders/servers have moved on. Visited just this week with friends, and sorely disappointed. It's attached to the Hotel Beresford, and I'm guessing that's the only way it stays in business.
They USE to have the best clam chowder anywhere in San Francisco. No longer. Not sure why. The bartender didn't seem interested in having a conversation. He did make a good drink but that was the highlight of a lackluster experience sitting around the bar.

Friends were comparing their cameras and looking through the lens, of course up into the light at the bar and all the bottles, and the bartender twice barked at them both that no pictures were allowed, and started to grab one camera from my friends hands. Luckily, he stopped short as I put my hand in front of the camera. No pictures were being taken tough guy, just looking at camera equipment. Chill. Bartender was a complete ass, skinny pepper haired 40 something probably paying a lot of alimony and mad at the world for only being a bartender at his age.

Red headed waitress is much more concerned about her smoke breaks than serving you. I heard one patron come from the seating area in back, up to the front of bar just to ask for a spoon. Bartender "pleasantly" (dripping with sarcasm) had to run to the kitchen to get one. Don't expect any smiles from either one.

Food is lackluster at best anymore. Service is pitiful for this day and age. 

Amazing no pics are allowed but yelp is full of them taken by others. Never going back.
author: Roger E.

description:
It's exactly what it claims to be: a pub with good fare and a relaxing vibe. The beer selection was a little underwhelming (only four taps?) but they made up for it with the whiskey list. The burger was surprisingly good (try the California!) and came with a boatload of crispy fries. 

The waitress was super attentive without being over the top and despite the gaggle of bros playing shuffleboard, I enjoyed my visit. I'd go back for the burger alone.
author: Josh G.

description: Great place for beers, pub food, and quiet, calm conversation.  Simple, friendly, warm.  Close to theater district for before/after show visits.  Relaxing place to unwind after a day downtown as a tourist or local showing out-of-town guests around our lovely city.
author: Scott C.

description: Cheap beer, great location. This is a great bar for a mid-night stopover. Bartenders are always great, music and games are on, and there's plenty of room to spread out.
author: Carli B.

description:
We decided to check out the White Horse since our hotel is just up the street. OMG I gotta tell ya that their $11 fish and chips was amazing. Most restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf touristy area would change double...or more! 
It's a tavern and a restaurant (Open for dinner only), kinda rough around the edges, but comfy booths and friendly service. 
Our waitress, Kate, was exceptional. 
We'll be back!
author: C R.

description: Definitely not a place to hang out if you want to have any fun. Waitress said if it got too loud the hotel next door would complain so no volume allowed on tv to watch the game. I would understand if it was 10:00 pm but it was 6:00. Server said manager would get mad if volume was on. We had it turned on really low and she turned it off. I went to A pub that was less of a snooze fest. On a positive note my group said the fish and chips were good.
author: Trey H.

description:
Whoever was working on NYE (guy) should be fired.  Probably one of the rudest bartenders I've ever seen. Yes, we did walk in late as a group, but he was treating everyone equally. For example, popping balloons in front of customers to make them leave (and not in a fun way), slamming empty glasses on tables (multiple times), shouting at customers for drink orders and then serving only shots at the end. If you can't handle bartending on NYE, get a new job.

My girlfriend waited until 1:30 for me to get off work   So we could have one drink together and this sorry excuse for a bartender ruined it.
author: Kris W.

description:
An interesting place. Walking in, it seems as if you're entering a traditional pub (English or Irish). It's more of a dive bar, that attracts an eclectic crowd including locals, tourists and families with children. Menu is basic: burgers, sandwiches and a few entrees: fish and chips, shrimp and chips, grilled chicken. The biggest surprise of all was the $16 NY strip steak. 

My friend ordered the Hawaiian burger and loved it. I had the fish and chips. They were nicely battered: crisp on the outside and warm and flaky inside. 

Beer selection is limited: 4 draughts.
author: Karen B.

description:
I'd probably like this place even more if I visited the neighborhood more often. But it's definitely going in my rolodex for "places near-ish Union Square that aren't awful/brimming with tourists."

I came here at the suggestion of some friends, and we pretty much took over the back near the shuffleboard table. I had a hot buttered rum when it was raining outside, which made everything seem more cozy. 

I was a bummed that the menu was pretty much just wings and burgers since the decor and ambiance of the place was screaming for shepherd's pie or bangers & mash, but the fish & chips fit the bill OK. The fish breading got soggy with the malt vinegar, which was disappointing but the fish itself was fine. 

I'd read about surly service from the waitress, and I could see what other reviewers meant, but didn't have a problem myself. It's pretty common to keep the bar tabs and the table tabs separate, so if you don't like how often she is or isn't coming around, then just order what you need at the bar.
author: Krista L.

description:
We happened upon this place while hunting for another bar.  We actually passed it up the first walk by but ended up in here on the way back.  What convinced me to come in (other than my husband) was the $2.95 Clam Chowder that was on the blackboard.  Done and done.

So I only had 2 food dishes.  The bar itself was a hole in the wall dive bar.  We ate in the bar area and the service was "eh" - but the food....real star food rating is 3.7.  First off, if you're just in for late night drinks there's no need to order anything.  If you've read other reviews there's free snacks for munching on a table by one wall.

Clam Chowder - ok, so there was a quick internal debate on whether ordering clam chowder at a hole in the wall dive bar was a good idea - but we were in SF, I love clam chowder, it was $2.95 - so why not?  White Horse Tavern you did not let me down.  The chowder was perfectly creamy, there was a good amount of good sized clams, and there were not big chunks of potatoes (I'm not a fan of big chunks of potatoes in any soup).  Great flavor and if you wanted to know, I was not sick the day after.

French Fries - this was a basket of never ending french fries.  We couldn't even finish the whole basket.  The french fries where thin and fresh fried crisp.

Definitely glad we stopped by.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Arrived after a flight from the UK.

What a friendly and welcoming place. The beer was great and the bacon and cheese burger was just amazing. 

This was just what was needed and I can't rate this food enough!
author: Ash T.

description: Friendliest staff ever. Good food. Very good prices, not even for the are just fantastic in general.
author: Samantha R.

description:
So my night at the white horse actually started off great.  I had a lot of fun watching the band and the bartenders were great and friendly.  It was at the end of the night that made my whole experience take a dive.  I did not know the bar was closimg as i was not paying attention to the time.  I was headed out to the patio to get some air as i was feeling a lot of anxiety in the place as it was very crowded something i had to do several times throughout the night.  ( a byproduct of my time in the military.)  

As i was headed out i was stopped by a door man and he asked what i was doing in a rude manner.  I said i am going out sode for some air and he said "no we are fucking close turn around and go the fuck inside".  If im lying im dying.  I said what? You know you could be a little more respectful when talking to people.  In which he responded " do we have a problem?"  Now i never cause problems anywhere and have many many friends in the bar industry and after talking to them about this i know it was innapropriate.   I said all i said is you could be nicer.  And he said " alright its time for you to go grabbing my arm and pushing me.  I pushed his hand off and he then TRIED to put me in a hold.  I got out of it and told him not to touch me.  I was not at all aggressive until he put his hands on me.  

Then another door man came up as i was trying to leave and they both grabbed me.  Now i knew fighting wpuld only make thinks worse and ruin my case.   So i left and i asked ti see the manager.  When the manager came out i explained everything in a calm manner and he said i dont beleive you i trust my guy amd not you.  

Now i have all this on video during that time the "head" of security came up and got in my face aggressively telling to get the fuck out of there and im on private property with alcohol on his breath.  He claimed to only have one shot but the stench from his mouth told me very different.  I told him that he could not legally do his job while intoxicated.  Had he not been intoxicated he may not have been so aggressive and had a more level head about him. I also explained that i would alert TABC and he said "TABC is all over us anyways so who cares" Iwanted to talk to the owner or someone else in charge.  He then pushed me and another guy throwing him down to the ground.  Me not so much.  I then explained i would call the police.  

When the police arrived i knew there would not be much they could do at that time. They asked me if i wanted to press asault charges on the head of security and to be honest i should have.  But i declined.  What they did tell me is that they have had issues like this before from this bar anx the best thing to do is to call TABC and file a complaint.  I told him I would.

Again i have this all on video and have not yet filed a formal complaint to TABC.  I want to speak with the owner.  If i cant then i will proceed with what i have to do.  I dont want this to happen to someone else.   Being a security gaurd or a bouncer or a door man does not give you rights to put your hands on someone.  Your job is to deescalate not escalate.  Your staff needs to be trained correctly.  I have been a bouncer, security gaurd, personal protection, and i know better.  I am just glad that i atleast could control my temper and have the peace of mind to do the right thing.
author: Cody A.

description:
Best clam chowder ever! Totally surprised because they don't advertise it outside or on the menu. It's written on a board, like a special, so you could easily miss it. For less than $3 it could be a cheap, but delicious meal on its own: hearty, full of clams, lots of flavor, generous portion. 

I also ordered 2 of the sliders which were delicious. FYI: on the menu it says each slider is $3.50 but if you order any 3, it's $12, which is actually more expensive than ordering them a la cart. I didn't ask, but maybe clarify if that comes with fries or something to justify the increased price. 

My husband got the mushroom burger. Again, hearty portion with amazing fries! Mmm...

The waitress was not warm and fuzzy, but she did a great job of being attentive. She kept our waters full, checked on us multiple times, and was quick with the check once we were ready.
author: Susan G.

description: We had stopped by for a quick bite and ordered two fat tires and two fish and chips with garlic fries.  This meal for two cost just over $36. The food, drinks, and service was good.  We have had better fish and chips in the area for a lot less.
author: Robert H.

description: I'm not sure why this place gets such a high rating. It's really old school, dank, and the air conditioner barely works. I stopped in because I read that they had an awesome steak and was highly rated in the Union Square neighborhood. The service is ok. I had a beer with a friend then left to get food elsewhere.
author: Wesley M.

description: I love this pub!!! Cheap drinks and food, what can be better! Also, their food is shockingly good. Best fish n chips in town! Brian and Lori (bartenders) are super cool to talk to too!!
author: Val G.

description:
My four stars are really a ranking for the atmosphere more than anything else. I love going to places that are small, quaint and quiet, but still lively in their own way. The crowd is usually pretty chill, with a mixture of older and middle age folk, and a sprinkling of younger people. 

The food is not extravagant, but definitely gets the job done. The portions are generous, the garlic fries garlic-y, and the popcorn is free. It's not anything remarkable, but it's comforting.
author: Sarah B.

description: White Horse Tavern was definitely A-OK. Fish and Chips were good, my only problem was that the french fries had too much salt on them, but I tend to think that most of the time, so I won't dock them.  Nothing amazing, but good food, reasonable prices, to bells or whistles.
author: Emma H.

description: Brian - the bartender - is the bomb - an intelligent, friendly, sensible guy, with a flair for witty conversation and a watchful eye for troublemakers. $5 Laginitas, all day.
author: Frank L.

description: There's not a huge menu, but what is there is lovingly prepared.  The staff and patrons are friendly.
author: Christopher H.

description:
I honestly have no idea how this pub has so many stars. I came here with a friend for drinks and food. The red headed waitress seemed nice at first but then I realized she was either drunk or on some kind of drugs. She kept stumbling around and ran into me a few times (I was sitting down and the bar was borderline empty). We ordered our food and we were halfway through before she brought out silverware (which btw didn't even really bother us)

She left us sitting there for an extended amount of time once we finished eating. She finally came back to check on us so we asked for the check and some to-go boxes. She disappeared for 20 minutes then came back and asked if we were doing okay (as if she didn't already ask us 20 minutes ago). I was polite and reminded her of the check and boxes. She disappeared for another 20minutes then came back and asked us again how we were doing without the check or boxes. I reminded her again for the 3rd time. She came back 10 minutes later without boxes, and somebody else's check and credit card. 

At this point it's clear she's incapable of doing her job and I have no idea after reading the reviews of this pub why she hasn't gotten fired. 

I take the credit card and check to the bar and wait patiently to speak with the bartender (blonde bigger woman). I explained to her I have someone else's credit card and I'd like to get my check so I can pay my bill. She told me I need to get it from my waitress. I told her in the nicest way possible that I wasn't sure she was capable of getting our bill since we've asked her 4 times in 45minutes and she gave us someone else's card (I said nothing about the possibility of her being intoxicated.) The bartender then explained to me she's not able to get the checks at the bar and I'll have to get it from the waitress, so I asked her if she knew where the waitress was. The bartender ignored my question, directed her attention to the woman next to me and proceeded to help her as if I didn't exist. 

Despite being completely dissed by the bartender when I was only trying to do the right thing, I'm honestly worried about the red headed waitress's health as she was clearly not sober. And to be that high or drunk while working says she's probably got some deep issues going on. Again, I have no idea how she hasn't been fired. They must not be doing well as a bar. I wonder why... lol
author: Katie R.

description:
We travelled to San Fransisco for a good weekend with our friends there. We had been looking for a bar where we could talk to each other without shouting and where the environment looked comfortable. The White Horse looked like the place as we stuck our heads in for a quick look!

My friend found us a seat and i went to buy us some drinks from the bar. this is where i am extremely confused how this bar, that gets good ratings, decided to hire (i  hope he is not the owner setting this sort of president) a short little bearded fellow with a chip on his shoulder and who perhaps through that he was in fact Conor McGregor. 

I asked "do you have a drinks menu?" and smiled at him. He stared straight at me and then abruptly said "No". 

For a second i thought he would then offer up some suggestions like every other place where customer service matters. Having worked in bars i thought i'd give him this moment to respond. He then looked at me, raised his eye brows and very condescendingly said "thanks a lot. good chat!" Having lived in the UK i know this sort of rude tough guy mentality does sometimes happen from time to time but usually its when customers are being rude and acting inappropriately. 

So in some shock i took in how much of a rude little boy our McGregor-want-to-be was and responded by saying how enjoyable the chat was for me also. 

I'm not sure why you would treat customers this way and as with all things in the internet age, we do have the ability to warn others not to waste their time attending bars where they are poorly treated.
author: Rick D.

description: Great, so casual, but really good food. Super laid-back, fun and easy, good even if you have little kids. Great prices. Burger was perfect, caprese-salad-sandwich also great, fries perfect. Forgot garlic fries we ordered as an appetizer but didn't charge  us for them and we had more than enough food anyway so it was actually better that way. The beers on tap were great and only $4 to $5. Have a shuffleboard table that was fun. Good friendly service. Really loved it
author: Jeanine C.

description: This place is fine if you are looking for a simple bar. The staff was nice and the food was okay, but it didn't really have anything that would keep me coming back. The fries were not great, but they had free snacks. So overall it was fine, but not anything special.
author: Heather M.

description: Wow the food was awesome and nicely priced. I had the New York steak and it was almost as good as a filet, the beans and mashed potatoes were equally as good. My hubby had the combo fish, shrimp and chips and loved it. Very filling portions. The only reason why I didn't rate a five star is because our server wasn't a five star server she was more like a 2or 3. She gave us the impression that we were inconveniencing her but she gave us prompt service it just would have been if there was more of an effort at a smile. We will definitely come back to eat.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
The best restaurant in Union Square that isn't a tourist trap or a money pit.

The White Horse is a neighborhood pub, plain and simple. It's kind of hokey with a fake fireplace, but c'mon now. $8 for a drink and wings? $5.50 for garlic fries? Free popcorn/nuts? Sa-wheet.

Just be warned -- the lone bartender is working double-time here. Make sure to tip her!
author: Casey S.

description: Such a good surprise! This place is old... I mean 1700's old. But it's clean and spacious and the staff are very nice and friendly. We got burgers and wings around 10pm on a weeknight and everything was delicious.
author: Ariel J.

description:
Nice little place. Never too crowded. If it does get crowded, there's plenty of space in the back to sit. Staff is nice.

I've tried their mushroom burger which is really good. It has a buttery taste. Their apple pie is also good.

$12 for a hamburger meal, but the portions are pretty big. It will definitely fill you up.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Aw man, this place is awesome. I love living less than 1 block from here.

1. Great food (although the past few times haven't been consistent), 
2. Diverse crowd (not all tech/startup bros),
3. Love the music,
4. Free popcorn/snacks, sometimes there's free hot dogs.
5. Never gets packed or too loud!

There's always this one grumpy waitress who will mostly ignore you and then tries to rush you out, even if there isn't much of a crowd. Everybody else has been nice.
author: Leah F.

description:
Another Yelp! find for the win.

On our last night in San Fran, my husband and I decided to pick hearty, simple fare close to our hotel, and the Tavern did not disappoint.

We both opted for the Island Burger, and they were cooked as ordered and the perfect portion size!  I took the safe route and stuck with the original fries, but regretted that when I sampled my husband's garlic fries... YUM!

Since I'm not a beer drinker, I ordered the drink on special, the "Fall Back" punch in honor of DST.  While not as fruity as I'd expected and hoped (given the bartender's description) it was a solid cocktail, and reasonably priced at $5.

Best of all was the atmosphere.  Modeled after a traditional English pub, I found the decor and small spaces charming and inviting.  We struck up a lively, informative conversation with a local filmmaker, and sharing conversation and food only added to the pleasant experience.

This is not where you want to visit for a fancy night-on-the-town dinner, but after a day of sightseeing, it was the perfect stop for a filling, tasty, well-priced American meal.

(And while I have a shellfish allergy and can't attest on personal experience, I hear the clam chowder can't be beat!)
author: Monica G.

description: Seems like a nice enough place but I've never encountered a ruder, less attentive or just plain worse bartender anywhere else in the city.
author: Harry N.

description:
My review went under tips!! 
Great place, food and service were all a 5 star! By far the best fish and chips!!
author: Louise B.

description: I'd yelp the crap out of this place!  Shuffleboard, popcorn and alcohol yay.  How long are these supposed to be? seriously I've said all I needed to say yelp.  What more do you want from me?
author: Marley H.

description:
This is a hidden gem in san francisco! I am a fan! There's even a shuffle board in the back! :D

Imagine a not so divey dive bar with dive bar prices, awesome wings and the real feel of an european pub, that's what you get at this place! I came here on a friday night with a few friends for food and drinks. We sat at the bar as all the tables were taken but it wasn't that crowded. The bartenders were busy but attentive and we were able to order food with them. We got a bunch of sliders and wings to share and a friend ordered the shrimp and chips. The wings were the star of the show. We got the lemon pepper ones. They were crispy and really flavorful! The sliders were a bit burnt, so they were nothing special, but the shrimp and chips were really good as well. On top of the food we got a variety of beers and cocktails.

For 4 people who got a bunch of drinks and food, the bill was a very reasonable $75ish. Super affordable place. I'm already planning my next trip there and dreaming of munching on some delicious wings! :')
author: Seliya G.

description:
Free hot dogs and popcorn. I could stop writing right now and be completely satisfied with my five star review. Anyone who serves free hot dogs and popcorn deserves five stars, period.

Anyway, White Horse Tavern is a dumpy pub near Union Square. I usually hesitate to try anything near this tourist-ridden area, but I gave old Whitey a chance and I'm glad I did. The drink prices are excellent and the draft selection is surprisingly good. It's not just the standard Bud Light and such. There are a few microbrews on tap as well.

The pub was empty on a Thursday at 6:30 PM. There were no TVs and no music. It felt somewhat sad but somewhat awesome at the same time. Regardless, I'm not sure why it wasn't packed because there were plenty of fresh hot dogs and popcorn to go around.

Again, let me stress the importance of free hot dogs and popcorn. These items are self-service, so don't be afraid to get up and grab a dog or a bag of corn. Please note that this doesn't affect the delightfulness of it all, but it's simply worth mentioning.

Come hungry, come thirsty and probably forget your wallet. White Horse delivers in the most unlikely of locations.
author: Nick K.

description:
Awesome place to grab a quick bite to eat! 
We wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory but the wait was forever and I yelped and found this place, and it was a great pick.. It was a nice walk a few blocks up.. If you are looking for a cool place to hang out and unwind this is your place. 

Pros - VERY reasonably priced menu.. And Probably the best fries I have ever had.. Nice chill atmosphere inside.. If you get super hammered they are connected to a hotel :) 

Cons - I wish they had more seating inside..they were busy for a Monday night!
author: Sahar H.

description: This is a great bar close to my house. It is rarely too busy to get a table right away, the food is really good, and they have beverages to suit anyone. The best part about this place is that its not pretentious. If you are looking for something low key with free bar snacks and good food and drinks, this is a great place.
author: Christina L.

description:
This is that place you go where you see that guy from undergrad.

No, you don't know his name.

You actually stare at him for about 10 minutes saying "I know that guy, why do I know that guy" to yourself until the person next to you tells you to give it up.

Then you realize he lived one dorm over, or maybe even in your dorm, and was at all the same events you were at.  Or how after you left the dorms and everyone splintered into their friend groups, this guy still came to all your parties because he inevitably knew some guy who knew someone else who actually got invited.

Anyway, that what this place is.  And a decent place to get a drink.

The atmosphere is top notch.  You feel like you're in some corner of a town in London, throwing one back at your local.  The old walls welcome a charming dinge that makes you feel like you're in a place where someone who did something great used to drink.  The bartenders are friendly enough and bottles of whiskey adorn the walls in a manner that looks like they don't really have an order, they just need to be there.

Not too much fancy in the way of beer.  Your usual suspects for "pub" type beer and some sweet Firestone DBA.

If the other places downtown seem too posh or too SF for ya, this is your spot.
author: Steven R.

description: Had a burger and some wings that were awesome! Our waiter was really nice and the service was super fast. Would definitely recommend!
author: Taryn O.

description: Thought I'd try this place to watch the beginning of the Giants game and have some fish&chips. When I walked in the first thing that hit me was Bar Rot.  That smell means things are not being maintained. A big red flag. I saw there was a TV in the bar area but it wasn't turned on. I asked the bartender if they would be showing Giants game. This seemed to annoy her. "No" she said, "We're concentrating on playoffs" which made no sense because there are no sports having a playoff game today. Strike Two horrible bar smell, rude service. I'm not gonna hang around for strike three. I'm gonna walk.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Looking for a place to eat dinner while visiting San Francisco and stumbled upon this place on yelp. It's has a very old timey renaissance feel which was neat. I loved the stable doors in the entrance. They played alternative rock music which gave it a little bit of a hipster feel. They also serve popcorn and pretzels if you're at the bar or table just snacking which is nice. 

The environment is very calm and low key. It's dimly lit and you sit in older wooden chairs to fit the mood. They have burgers, wings, and sandwiches. Classic bar type of feel with plenty of craft beer. I ordered the $12 chicken sandwich and was content with it. It wasn't anything special or different. My cousin had the California burger and felt the same. Wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. I'd go look for something with a little bit more adventurous food. Not bad.
author: Danielle V.

description: This place is fun and the food is good. A local bar and restaurant where the atmosphere is lively. The burger is gluten free (without the bun) and so are the fries (which are delicious). I highly recommend it if you're looking for a fun evening out
author: Jennifer K.

description:
So, few of my friends came to the bay from la to visit a friend. Came here not knowing where we should eat and drink for dinner. Got the wings. Below mediocre. Beer and service great. Didn't get free hotdogs.


Why the 3 star?? Well, 4 group of Asians grabbing some beer and chicken and down to paying the check. Waitress politely asks us if we are local and what not. And then she goes "hey!!! We are going to have new a flavor soon!! TERIYAKI!!" I replied with "make sure you have some garlic on em" just to ease out the racist remark she just handed to us. Then she goes "better yet!! We're going to have sesame seeds on them!!" We just nodded in awkwardness, confused whether if she was being seriously genuine or she just don't know she was being slightly racist 2x.


Anyways, if you get wings get them with garlic & if you get fries get it with extra garlic.
author: Daniel L.

description: Food was rather inexpensive,  beer was cold,  and the was great staff.  The location was perfect with close proximity to Union Square.  According to my husband.... for the price,  the steak was the best he has ever had! Loved this little pub!
author: ChyAnn C.

description:
So, I have a beer at Molotovs and have three more at Lucky 13. You locals (like me), know the drill. 

I decide to have one more... at some place different. 

That's how I ended up here.

LOL!

Not all tourists, to my surprise. 

Seems to be somewhat a hangout for English ex-pats. 

Free popcorn on this Saturday night. 

Kind of an interesting pub. 

Check it out.
author: Chuck G.

description: The food quality is okay and the drinks are okay.  Many of the items were out when we visited this place.  They don't really have a specialty drink menu so it's pretty straight forward.  The seating area is limited.  There are other better bars places around the block.
author: Xing M.

description:
Fine bar service terrible attitudes. Multiple times people came up to the bar to order drinks and were chastised, told to go back to their tables to order from their waitress in a very curt manner. Clearly if they were being serviced they wouldn't be ordering from the bar? 

Really rude bar tender treating patrons poorly, from the view of someone sitting on the outside of the bar.
author: Lynne D.

description:
Ordered a Mexican Slider and the Shrimp and Chips.  

Let's start with the good - the Mexican Slider was quite good, much better than I expected.  You could taste the char of the grill and the meat was at a nice medium to medium-rare temperature.  The corn really added an interesting zing to the slider. 

After the mouth-sized slider, I moved on to my main entree with great expectations. However the shrimp and chips turned out to be a big let down.  The breading on the shrimp was so ridiculously thick, and each fry tasted like it had a tablespoon of salt on it.  In hindsight I should have just thrown away the breading on the shrimp - it completely covered up the taste of the shrimp itself, leaving only the taste of oil and breading in your mouth.  

Service was slow, but at least our waitress was friendly.  Free popcorn was a plus. Based on the slider I want to believe I ordered the wrong thing, but until I go again (unlikely) I may never find out.
author: Lee F.

description:
If you like pubs, you'll love this place. It looks small on the outside, but it's much bigger inside. The decor and ambiance reminds me of some of the pubs that I went to in England, Scotland, and Ireland. There aren't to many seats at the bar area, but there are plenty of wooden tables and chairs around the area. There are even a few seats by a fire place. 

They have free hot dogs, pretzels, and popcorn around the bar area. Pretty cool! I didn't see that until my friend and I were ready to leave. He knew about that but forgot to tell me that it's free. Oh well, maybe next time I'll grab some of the free snacks. The prices for the drinks here are reasonable. I forgot how much the price was for my drink since my friend paid for this round. The people here seem cool and down to earth from the bartender to the patrons. I'd definitely come back here the next time I'm in the area.
author: Butterfly A.

description: I ordered the steak and it was very tender cooked to Perfection flavorful and one of the best steaks I've had outside of my own BBQ Pit also the menu says herbs potatoes and vegetables and I ordered mine to go potatoes are fabulous and the vegetable is asparagus and cooked to perfection
author: Kareen E.

description:
DON'T GO!
Well, I mean, if you want to get abused by the Bartender (slim guy with facial hair) and suffer getting your drink SNATCHED before you finish it, or getting a snide comment when you ask what kind of beers are on tap, then go for it! Took some out of town guests here for a late night cap and was thoroughly embarrassed and shocked to have been treated so badly by the bartender. He even grabbed my arm as he snatched my drink, which would normally have prompted a police report had I not been in shock and still recovering from his screams of "GET OUT" at 5 minutes to closing!  Wow!  Really??? who does the hiring here, anyway?!? From the other one star reviews, the staff issues seem to be the major problem. Many, many establishments to spend your hard earned cash on that would appreciate customers instead of abusing them!
author: E L.

description: White Horse feels like something out of a play. Maybe it is because the patrons are mostly theatre makers or patrons. Actually wish they could play up the old timey tavern aspect a little bit more. Nothing super special about the place, but nothing really bad either. All the free peanuts and popcorn you could want with your reasonably priced drinks. Pretty good deal in this town.
author: Jake A.

description: No cell service inside. Waitress was impolite. Fish and chips greasy. Desert was unavailable. Refills cost extra.
author: Keith C.

description: They really are nice here. I don't stop in enough, but that's what keeps it special. The garlic fries here really are out of this world. I can't think of anything that would improve them. It's a pub, so it's silly to say I wish they had some vegetarian food, but I do kind of wish they did.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: I am a semi-regular for happy hour and occasionally come by during later hours. I do so because of the great vibe that comes from the nice mix of the local regulars with the hotel guests--visitors from around the country as well as international tourists. The bartenders, Lori, Brian and Jack, along with server extraordinaire, Kate, are all wonderful in their own ways...each professional in their approach and attitudes. Once you get to know them you can't help but love each one of them.
author: Phil S.

description:
I had friends visiting from Vegas and we all stayed at the Beresford hotel for two nights and went to white horse before & after heading out the city both noon and night shift bartenders & waitress had a bit of an attitude. For our last night we decided to just do a chill night at white horse we were a group of 10 so we decided to stay at the back end of the bar, didn't mind that there's no waitress to take our orders but almost every time I go back to the bar the bartender is smoking. I didn't really mind I'm a smoker too so I understand, one thing I didn't understand is why he's being really rude we heard the last call but there wasn't any announcements about closing the back end of the bar. The bartender speed walked towards us with a huge trash bin and just started grabbing empty beer bottles in our table and tossed it hard in the bins like he wants it to break, while saying that we have to finish our drinks in the front by the bar. Very intimidating. 

Some of my friends that smokes went straight out the bar with their drinks, I was the last one to go out so I didn't see it until the same bartender started running behind me and started grabbing the drinks off my friends hands and said "I don't know where you guys are from but I can get fired with this! So f**k you!" Didn't really know how to react to that. Ok it was an honest mistake my friends are from Vegas and probably forgot but to actually say that to your customer? He could've handled that situation better especially that white horse and Beresford hotel have the same owner. Labeled on their website "The friendliest hotel in San Francisco" #beresfordhotel #whitehorse
author: paolo c.

description:
Free popcorn, Magner's cider. 
Andrew got a hotdog and stuffed his face.
Warm & cozy from the outside elements.
Cheeky bartender. Fun crowd.

= good times!!!

(ps- this was the last of a string of bars that evening. Great stop!)
author: Kristeen O.

description: Good beer deals, but holy cow, try the sliders. They are cooked medium with great flavor and the 3 sloder combo comes with a bucket full of fries for only $12.
author: Chris M.

description: The pub was awesome! We checked it out last night and loved the service, the free popcorn, and the selection of brews. They had games, a large selection of seats and was quite large for having the cozy feel. I really liked it here and will definitely frequent in the future!
author: Alex C.

description:
$4-5 draft beers, free popcorn and hot dogs during happy hour and shuffleboard - what else do you want from a dark, hotel lobby bar?

Exactly...
author: Abby S.

description: Bartender/waitress has an attitude and constantly forgets to tend to her tables after only a 1st round of drinks and food. Not a place to get even decent service. Food is ok.
author: Shelby C.

description:
Great bar, great cozy atmosphere, with the friendliest bartender I've ever met!

If you don't want a bar that's pretensious or a party scene (or too loud) come here!
author: Cori N.

description: I was with a group of people last night enjoying the opening night of their play, so the bar was pretty packed. I understand that the bar has a famously rude red headed waitress, however her actions last night were uncalled for. Yelling "EXCUSE ME" and "MOVE" are one thing, but when she actually ELBOWED my boyfriend (who is in a sling with a broken collarbone) out of her way because she had A drink in her hand, is entirely uncalled for in any situation. Tap someone on the shoulder or say excuse me if you need to get by like anyone else. I'll not be returning to this establishment.
author: Alesia C.

description: Surprisingly really good food.  Came here one late night in San Francisco and given the fact there was no wait here, but a 2 hour wait everywhere else I didn't expect much.  They some good beers on tap, my burger was very tasty and cooked just right and I quite enjoyed the shuffleboard table in the place as well.  Not the nice trendy decor or menu that you might expect in this part of SF, but good food at comfortable place.
author: W. Dane N.

description: Good place, nice atmosphere, tasty beer for 4 bucks. Good place to be for a couple of drinks
author: Moris I.

description:
My friend and I wandered in looking for a drink before she had a hair appt up the street. If you are in this neighborhood, stop in a get a drink. 

We sat down at a table and the people next to us say "get the hot dog". A little confused, my friend and I looked over to see a small table in the corner with FREE bar snacks that include popcorn, pub mix and yes, HOT DOGS! Now, I know what you are thinking, how good can a free weird bar hot dog be? Well, let me tell you, it was delicious. 

The bar is pretty big and there were lots of tables available. The drinks were strong and the prices were great. I'll definitely be back the next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: Brianne E.

description: Impeccable food, garlic fries are incredible and perfectly compliment the spicy wings. One of the very few places that sell ice cold, refreshing beer along with fantastic service. Being a Brit myself, I walked through the door and immediately felt as though I was back in my local pub in Wales.
author: Lewys J.

description:
I COULD BASICALLY LIVE HERE!
Great food, heavy pouring and friendly bartenders.
author: Y F T.

description: This place had one of the best burgers I ever had! The service was great, and I really liked the atmosphere. Will definitely make this one of my go-to pubs!
author: Lexi L.

description: Such a neat little pub in SF! The inside really looks like a real British pub. A girl sitting next to us at the bar that was from England said she felt like she was back home. The bartender was really friendly and quick at getting our drinks. They also have free popcorn and pub mix to snack on while you're there. I was there late at night so I didn't eat any of the food from their kitchen, but I wish I had! The fish and chips looked amazing. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in SF.
author: Ashley S.

description: Intimate atmosphere. Great prices. Small but delicious menu. Delicious beer. Popcorn, nuts, and pretzels on the house. We sat by the (gas) fire, which was very cozy. Enjoyed the old guns and even a cross bow hanging above the mantle. Old weathered wood, low light. Fantastic.
author: Troy M.

description: Well the food was great. Except my Spanish slider had a lot of salt. But the service could have been better. To our waitress i'd say SMILE!!! At least pretend you care. And then the table next to us asked us if we were leaving soon bc they wanted to play some game. Rude!!! Which of course I had to voice my feedback to them on that. Such a shame considering the drinks and the food are good. Guess I can say, I came, I saw, I conquered...better luck next time.
author: Cristina P.

description: This is one of my new favs. A really cool and unassuming pub. With a popcorn machine and a shuffleboard set up this place is the perfect demonstration of just how how much a neighborhood dive can achieve!
author: Oleg H.

description: This place has everything I need - delicious food, shuffleboard and stiff drinks.  Kind of a hole in the wall but if you're good with laid back bars you will agree it's a diamond in the rough.  Definitely worth checking out!
author: Lacy S.

description:
This is based on just popping in for a round while wandering the streets, but if you are looking for a nice, friendly laid back joint with free salty popcorn, this is the place. Happy hour prices are pretty good. They did not have the free hot dogs on Friday, which the bartender told me that they changed the menu a few days before. They still have them Monday-Thursday, if I remember correctly.

Anyway, good service and a good local atmosphere. The menu looked good, with garlic fries and other munchies for us early evening boozers.
author: Barney T.

description: Not bad for a local establishment. Waitresses seem very rushed, but at least they are nice about it. Really small place and they really cram in the tables making the seating pretty cozy. Food was really good for the price.I had the NY Strip, it was plastered with sauce, but I guess that's how they do it in London...
author: Seth J.

description: The place is cool and definitely a chill place to hang. Service depends on who is working. One bartender is sociable and good at what he does, the other needs to find a different line of work. Seems weird to go to a place that has a bartender that acts as though he hates being there. Food is good but won't be back.
author: Guido M.

description: No, I would not go.  Good beer, but that's all I'm willing to say, and yes, I ate there too.
author: Alfredo V.

description: Very friendly staff - Julie was awesome. Nice atmosphere. Food rocked. GET THE GARLIC SWEET POTATO FRIES!!
author: Janet R.

description:
There is no food aside from popcorn and hot dogs (which we were too late for).

Good beer, good atmosphere, great place to hang out. But it's NOT a restaurant!
author: Adam G.

description: Very nice and casual atmosphere, reasonably priced drinks, and free popcorn. I didn't get a chance to try the food, but the people in my group that got food seemed pleased with it.
author: Antonett M.

description:
A shuffle board.
Free Food (hot dogs, popcorn and nibbles - depending on the bar tender).
Cheap drinks, and British Beers.

The moment I step through the door I feel like I'm walking into the pub on my corner back in England.

Warm, inviting - great for a quiet drink or for big groups.

LOVE the WHITE HORSE.
author: Hannah K.

description:
I've gone to the Marine Memorial theatre 2 weekends in a row now, and after the show, we like to kick back and relax at this quiet little tavern. They've got an absolutely jam packed bar, and quite the selection of single malts. 
We got in around 11, and the place was just beginning to fill up. Order your drink at the bar, grab a table and catch up. The bartender is super friendly. 
Along with your drinks, they have free pop corn to munch on, which definitely helps keep you there, as you savor the atmosphere, and the good drink.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
A GREAT place to hang out and shoot the s**t when downtown. Comfortable chairs, nice ambience, and a half-decent beer selection. Has the feeling of a British pub in that it feels like a community center rather than somewhere where you just drink.

Plus, free hot dogs and hummus. And the free hot dogs aren't just a sometimes thing. They're an always thing. You don't need to wait for baseball season or rely on the Giants' performance in order to rely on free food waiting for you when you get there.
author: Taylor W.

description:
Awesome pub. 

Really nice decor that seemed kinda-English-y-like-or-something.  I've never been to England so I can't say, but it satisfied my hollywood fueled preconception of what an English pub should look like, so that's good.  Better than that, though, was the spacious interior with plenty of tables and seating.  A bit quiet, perfect for chatting with friends, without too much shouting.   

Additional bonuses were the free popcorn and hot dogs (free hot dogs!?).  I didn't partake of the hot dogs, but, yeah, that's a nice touch.   

My only reservation is the beer selection, which felt a bit lacking.  Only 4 taps, and they weren't all that stellar - or english.  Still, I will return, and I certainly recommend it for a casual, non-sceney evening session.
author: Travis B.

description: I never review on Yelp before but . . . This was fantastic. Staying in the Beresford hotel for the next couple of days. Was hesitant about checking out the restaurant but I am so glad that we did. Our server Julie was nothing short of amazing. Service was fast. Food was delicious. Extremely reasonable prices ($16 was the most expensive that I saw) and huge portions. Try the garlic sweet potato fries they are amazing. Beresford and Whitehorse Tavern gives you the bang for ur buck !
author: Nikki F.

description: This is an unfair rating because I have not eaten here, but we went here just for the Tavern (beer) part, not the restaurant.  And while I love the atmosphere (minus the loud bros playing table shuffleboard), there just weren't that many beers on tap.  VERY few.  The price was good, but the options were surprisingly low.  Not a place just to come for beers if you like selection.
author: Tarah D.

description: Hidden gem among the locals!  STIFF drinks at a fraction of what you will pay elsewhere in SF!  Super friendly staff - a real CHEERS kind of place you will LOVE!
author: Lynne P.

description:
Free hotdogs!

But go fuck yourself if you set a beer down on the shuffleboard table.  We got yelled at by the bartender.  Sorry.

The White Horse Tavern has a small beer selection on tap and the long open room in back with giant tables is great for big parties.  Plus we found a pair of black leather women's boots.  

Free boots!
author: Stephen C.

description: One review stated, "Best restaurant in Union Square". Seriously?? Had the shrimp and chips. The shrimp were so heavily coated, I mean BURIED, in breading that you could barely tell what the hek they were! With that being said, although I would never have dinner here again, the ambience and free popcorn make it worth a quick stop for a beer.
author: Beth G.

description: Meh... Fish and Chips were soggy and under-seasoned, Wings weren't anything to write home about either. Waitress was apathetic.  Not on my "go back" list for food.  I passed 4-5 other places including Jack in the Box on the walk back to my hotel (4 blocks) that would have likely been better.
author: Wade T.

description: Had to walk out after food never came. 45 min for a salad and a few wings on a slow night. We were Ignored when we walked in. Bartender was a pretentious A-hole.
author: Blaine S.

description: Worst customer service ever. We stood inside the door feeling foolish while being completely ignored.  The bar is in the front of the house and the bartender ignored us...so we inched in to the dining area where the most miserable looking female server ignored us and hid behind a corner to avoid us at all costs.  We will never return.  Too bad, because we were told the food was good!
author: Jordan S.

description: Cool but dank movie theateresque stuffiness in the air as far as ambiance goes, old English bar decor is nice but the bartender spilled my beer and got me a new one and charged for both i tried to ask and got nasty attitude I do not recommend until new staff is hired.
author: Zhang W.

description: Friendly bartenders, strong drinks, inexpensive, free popcorn. Seems like a lot if regulars hang out here, but they were all friendly and easy to chat with as well. Didn't try the food. Go here if you're nearby and want a cheap, strong drink!
author: Chris B.

description: If you love pub food this is as good as it gets! Chicken sandwiches and hamburgers are killer, wings are amazing and the garlic fries are out of this world! Plus during happy hour you can get a beer and six wings for eight bucks, and it's pretty filling.
author: Jessica J.

description: Love it here - would be my local if I lived in the area. Nice chilled atmosphere, great chats to be had with others at the bar & the bar staff. Plus, there's free fresh popcorn!
author: Tracy O.

description:
Low key, chill, dingy, comfortable... this bar is a perfect example of how a shithole can morph into a cosy little neighborhood hang out place.

Three things that helped this place earn a 5 star:
1) Free popcorn, bar snacks, and sometimes hot dogs. Fuck yes.
2) Shuffleboard tables, which are clearly way classier than any other bar sport.
3) Comfortable couches that make for a sublime after-work hangout spot.

I'll be coming here again. And I'll be the guy that devoured all the freaking hot dogs.
author: Nick A.

description:
Beer selection = decent
Popcorn = free
Ambiance = awesome
Shuffle board table = stellar
Night out at the White Horse = Priceless.
This place is one of my favorites.
author: Chris G.

description: Good food but bad service. There was only one girl working the place and she seemed very inexperienced and overwhelmed. We had to wait 5-10 minutes for drinks and she brought out water without ice. And when we asked for more drinks or condiments we never got them. Interesting and cozy atmosphere. The burgers and wings were very yummy, and I loved the fries.
author: Laine H.

description: We came by for a casual nosh before going to see a show. It lived up to the reviews. Great casual atmosphere, friendly pub service with way above average food. Prices are more than fair. I recommend the clam chowder and fish & chips.  Chowder is hearty and flavorful, fish has a wonderful crispy coating with large tender fish beneath. Hope I get to come back tomorrow.
author: George T.

description: Decent local bar, met some cool people. The beer is cheap, but they don't have a huge selection of beer (4 taps I believe). I was expecting an english type bar, but it's not english at all.
author: Jonah K.

description: We only had drinks here so I can't comment on the food, other than the awesome free popcorn! Drinks were great. Ambiance was great - kind of dim/dark and the music was good. Wait staff was friendly. It's linked to a hotel and they had the cleanest, nicest restrooms. Prices were good so I'd be back in a heartbeat if I lived there!
author: Evie K.

description: The service was terrible! We ordered our burgers well done, but my sister's was medium. That wouldn't have been a huge deal if our waiter had come over and asked us if everything was okay. He never came to our table to ask if we needed anything, refill our water or give us a check. After waiting 30 minutes after finishing our dinner for the check, I had to go up to the bartender to ask for it. She went outside to try to find our waiter, but this time he was inside siting at a table visiting with people. When she finally found him, she told him we wanted our checks. It was still another 10 minutes before we got our checks. I had even put in a to go order for my husband, which got cold during the 40 minutes we had to wait for him to bring us the check. Even that would have been understandable if the place had been busy. There weren't that many people in the place, and the worst part about it all was that the waiter went outside to smoke a cigar, came back inside to have a drink at the bar, sat down to visit with people at a table and went back outside for another smoke and repeated the cycle all over again instead of providing any service whatsoever! I am very disappointed.
author: Mindy J.

description: Very laid back old Brit type pub. I really like the place and staff. Prices are so reasonable. I will definitely be back
author: Selin K.

description:
Pub Crawl Stop #4~

It's rare to feel this way in San Francisco, but it happened. About 15 of us Asian peeps walked into the tavern, and immediately stares were felt. It wasn't only for one or two seconds. People were glued onto us for our entire stay (which didn't last long btw). No smiles, except for the bartender. It felt as if we had invaded another country. It might have been the alcohol, but some of us thought people were going to shoot us with the muskets on the wall.
author: Marti L.

description:
Stopped by the White Horse for happy hour with some co-workers. The bar tender was super friendly and they had a ton of free snacks! Including hot fresh popped pop-corn, hot dogs, nuts, and pub mix. 

The atmosphere was low key, and it is a great place to go if you actually want to hold a conversation, they don't have loud music pumping in the 
background. 

Extra bonus: they have a shuffle board table!
author: Stephanie T.

description: My experience was terrible. We got there and from the start the red-headed waitress was very rude. We were in a party of 9. She interrupted us when we were trying to talk to her and ask her questions and she had a very unwelcoming and ill-mannered tone. When we ordered our food, we asked if the burger was a shareable size and the waitress made it seem like the burger was huge, when it came, it was small and defiantly not a shareable size. Also, we ordered the chicken wings, and they didn't come when the rest of the food was served. about 10 minutes later we asked if the chicken wings were on their way. The waitress responded very rudely and with a lot of attitude. our chicken wings still hadn't have come after 20 minutes of everyone else getting their food. Everyone finished eating and we still hadn't got our chicken wings. When we asked the waitress about it again, she said that the fryer was having a problem and that they would be out in a few minutes. But the thing is, all the stuff that was ordered by the rest of our group was fried! Like French fries, fish and chips, and shrimp and chips. It was just an excuse. After 35 minutes, we ask the waitress why the wings hadn't come and she was still saying the fryer was have issues! They didn't offer to give them to us for free, or to take the drinks off the tab or anything. They didn't do anything to makeup for the fact that we weren't getting our food. We told her we didn't want the wings and we paid and left. I do not recommend going here for the service is terrible and the food is ok. I tried the fries and the shrimp and they were alright. But overall, I would defiantly choose a different place to eat.
author: Bretta P.

description: Completely underwhelmed.  Service OK but could the waitress put a smile on her face?  That would go a long way!  Hubby and I each had sliders - tiny but sufficient.  Average in taste...  Garlic fries were ok - but only if you LOVE lots of garlic....  Too many other choices in San Fran...  Don't waste your time....
author: Kellene V.

description: Great place for a meal and part of our hotel.  Good atmosphere in the bar and can't agree with Cassie about the service.  It certainly wasn't our experience.
author: Stafford R.

description: I had the island burger (not sure if that's the actual name--pineapple is the main feature). It was perfectly cooked to medium rare as I had requested. I asked for their garlic fries instead of the standard ones and was NOT disappointed. What made this a 5-star experience was the excellent customer service by the bartender. He kept me happy for sure. There was also a table nearby that had apparently had been waiting a while, and he offered to buy them beers.
author: Sam R.

description:
For the day and a half we were in San Fran, we avoided this tavern because we were on the hunt for Belgian beers/pub with dart boards, and White Horse doesn't have either.  After walking the city all day long, we wanted to settle up to a pub that was close to the Marines' Hotel (practically next door).  The bars with Belgian beers were either closed on Monday night or they were too far of a walk for our barking dogs (feet).
Anyway, I'm glad we did hang out at the White Horse.  We had a great time and our sore neck is proof.  We played shuffle board so long our necks hurt for three days.
This is a rustic, casual, and laid-back pub.  The patrons included college-age kids, young and old professionals, and a couple of local folks,  The pub offers tap and bottled beers, whiskeys and other spirits, complimentary hot dogs (offered until they run out), and complimentary popcorn throughout the night.
When we return to San Fran, and we're staying close by, we'll definitely stop by the White Horse again; hubby wants a rematch at shuffle board.  I whopped his ass!
author: Tammy B.

description:
Just the place I wanted to go for a couple of pints.  Quite surprising this is a hotel bar.

The draft beer lineup was Trumer Pils, Lagunitas IPA, Firestone Walker DBA, and New Belgium Brewing Fat Tire.  All for $4-$5.  I didn't check out the bottle selection beyond noticing they had Pabst Blue Ribbon.

The also have a full bar with some respectable whisk(e)y offerings.

The free popcorn, pretzels, and bar mix were a nice treat.  A subsequent visit was timed to partake of the free hot dogs.

Service was fast and friendly.

Will definitely be back.
author: Joe P.

description: $4 dollar Guinness (can, not draft)  Umm, yes please!  Went here on a Friday night with a group of friends and it was pretty dead.   You know what though?  Sometimes I actually want to be able to sit down with my friends and actually be able to hear what they are saying.... this is a great place for that.  Besides, if there had been a lot of people there we might have been embarrassed by the number of refills we helped ourselves to of the popcorn.
author: Chloe M.

description:
I have been here a few times for drinks and each time has been an enjoyable experience. Each time the bartender has been Lori and I really like her. She is sweet, sociable and knows what she is doing. She pays attention to you and what you have been ordering. 

I'm not sure if it's every night but I know one Saturday night I was there they were serving free hot dogs. That's pretty cool. Free is a good four letter word. 

I have met a nice assortment of people here who have interesting stories to share. If you are looking for a loud crazy place full of young trendy people, you probably won't like this place. I would describe this place as a comfortable place to hang with friends and have good conversation. If you are friendly and open to chat with others despite their age, you could have a very memorable time. The last time I went I started speaking to the older group sitting next to me at the bar and I had a blast. They were friendly and very entertaining. Give White Horse a chance. You could end up with some neat new drinking acquaintances.
author: Liz M.

description: The first time we went here the bartender(s) were very grumpy.  We thought we would go back and try again to see if maybe they had an off night - Nope, still grumpy.  Never again.
author: Eva H.

description:
I dig the cheap old-world ambiance they have going on inside.

Drinks are very reasonably priced and come with infinite FREE hot dogs and popcorn! Super nice bartender too.
author: Natalie M.

description: Its an oldish pub, exactly what I like, and the food is fantastic! One of the best steaks we've had on our trip and it was $16! Also serves free popcorn whilst you wait for your meal!
author: Bek S.

description:
Free hot dogs and popcorn.  Cheap, stiff drinks. A friendly bartender. 

Yep. I'm in. 

Bottom line: Even if this place wasn't next door to my office, I'd be just as in love with it.
author: Kellie T.

description:
I had a great time, a delicious drink, and felt pretty comfortable in this cute, casual pub ... even among all the 20-somethings in their dressy duds. Back in my day, 20-something guys just didn't wear button-up dress shirts on a Saturday night. I enjoyed the sociological observations --  I also studied their language (poor), their manners (poor), their mating rituals (awkward)  ... I was the Margaret Mead of the White Horse!

Oh yeah, the bar snack mix is pretty good ... 
transcending the generational boundaries one pretzel at a time.
author: Rosie M.

description: Fantastic little bar!!!  Great selection, plus Fireball.  Nice to have shuffleboard too!!
author: Brian A.

description: Know this is not a restaurant.  This is not an ATM, this is a bar and they have mixed drinks, a few beers on tap, and bottled beer.  They also have good popcorn and apparently hot dogs we were too late for but it was 10pm so wasn't expecting it.  Love the inside, small and quaint - looks like an Old English tavern.  Seems like a lot of regulars come here.  No tvs but there is a shuffleboard table in the back.  A big variety of ages in here from college to some older folks.  Staff is really nice.  Had a good time.
author: Heather G.

description: Fun place and a great staff. Lemon Pepper Chicken Wings are the best!
author: Keith P.

description:
Was just like an English or Kiwi pub. Small selection of beers, but good ales in the selection. 

We settled in for a couple of beers, and next thing you know we're talking to visiting Kiwis (in the process of becoming Aussies), and it was just like hanging out in either London or Wellington. The entire crowd seemed friendly, without some of the attitude that convention attendees bring to local establishments. This was likely because (a) it was just beyond the range of that crowd, and (b) the only convention in town was a really geeky one that attracts very few of the local conventioneers.

They were out of free hot dogs by the time that we got there (~8 PM).
author: Mike C.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, we chose this place to meet and dine before going to a show.  Good call.

It's got flavor.  I like the pub atmosphere.  Our server (who was also the bartender when the first of our party arrived before 6pm) was gracious and attentive.  At times, the bar service was a little slow for drink refills, but we weren't in a huge hurry.

We all got carnivore plates: pork chops, meatloaf, and filet mignon.  All were very good, and the asparagus that was served with it was perfect and delicious.  My filet was prepared perfectly to my order and seasoned nicely.  The bread and chive mashed potatoes were good but not outstanding.  I'd definitely come here again and recommend it.
author: Linda M.

description: I have been there for dinner twice.  It's a casual place with good pub food.  The service is great and the food is consistently good.  The most unique thing about this place is the space - it's decorated like an old English pub.  I wouldn't say they have pulled it off but it's interesting.  It's not noisy or crowded and there are some regulars at the bar.  The age group is on the older side.
author: Rich K.

description:
free hot dogs and popcorn? looks like i have a new kitchen :) 

place is great, surprisingly wasnt that crowded for a Friday night, and was able to grab a table for four people. good pub to go to to chat with friends without the loud music or crazed sports fans. i dont remember seeing a TV in there so wouldnt plan to watch a game here. 

bar is attached to the lobby of the hotel so overflow of bar guests can make their to the lobby. and yay for clean non-club-puke-smelling bathrooms!
author: Crystal M.

description:
At the risk of repeating what's already been said, this bar is wonderful!  Free hot dogs & popcorn!!!!!  On top of that, it's got a wonderful ambience.  Sitting in the tavern makes me feel as though I am in a small bar in England.  This bar is a welcome change from the many pretentious, overpriced bars in the area.  Good prices.  Good drinks.  Good feel to it.  And of course, hot dogs.  

The owner is very friendly and the regulars are a lot of fun.  I will definitely be returning any time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jocelyn J.

description: I've always had fun here.  Good beer, free popcorn and interesting clients.  If you like fancy places then don't go here...they would appreciate that.
author: Chris G.

description:
Cozy little pub adjacent to an old hotel on Sutter St.  My family are all from the South Bay, but decided to spend Christmas up in the city.  Ended up at the White Horse on Christmas Eve and had a good ol' time.  This is a conversationalist's bar.  Friendly people -- and you can tell the regulars are all friends, having built this community amongst the bar-goers -- but they're not exclusive either, so you feel completely welcome there, even if you're a semi-tourist.  

They've got free popcorn, too.  :)
author: Cat T.

description:
White horse you've done it again!

You lure me in with your free munchies and cheap beer.
5 drinks set me back $18 including tax and tip. I also got some free popcorn and 2 free hotdogs. Not the best meal but I will say you please my student stomach and student wallet when times are tough!

Bartenders are ALWAYS friendly. They always are chatting it up with the tourists at the bar. You'll usually see a group of art students near the back. Laughing loudly and being just being plain silly.

Good atmosphere. Good prices. Next to class? WINNER
author: Amanda S.

description:
Beer selection was limited but decent. Full Bar as well.
They have a shuffleboard table! (16' Shuffleboard champion)
Lots of space. Free popcorn (and hotdogs when i was there a few weeks ago! Awesome!)

My only real complaint was that the shuffleboard needed lights. The back room is very spacious and very dim. Mellow vibe. mixed crowd.
author: M. W.

description: No longer a restaurant despite its name. They can offer you hotdogs and popcorn. Which are free if you are drinking.
